definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: But it is a big mistake to tell too many people where you're heading.
sentences.chinese: 但不能告诉太多人你的方向，否则将铸成大错。

sentences.english: Acceptance of this view would end up in gross errors.
sentences.chinese: 接受这种观点就会铸成大错。

sentences.english: Such an attack would be a mistake.
Ignoring the rural market, we believe, is a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我们相信，不进军农村市场的企业正铸成大错。

definition: a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to let emotions affect one's decisions
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
